items.preText: 2.29pm The openers are walking out, and it looks like Mashrafe Mortaza will have the ball in hand. Over the wicket to Masakadza to start. Zeeshan Mahmud: "Sensing Kayes double, I have exclusively made myself an Odyssian pact not to watch the match rather in a blissful zen mood follow commentary here at 1:25 am." - well done Zeeshan Mahmud. Let's hope Kayes doesn't disappoint. mehedi38: "Great opportunity for young top order batsman of BD team. Remember this is the last chance for top orders like Liston, Imrul and Santo because when Tamim will back next series from among these 3 players only one or two will get the chance." Tanvir: "I'm keeping an on Fazle Mahmud as he didn't have a memorable debut he has all the capability to be a solid match winner. And most importantly he is playing in the spot of Shakib. Let's see weather he can continue his form of domestic cricket in international arena. " 2.24pm Hamilton Maskadza said he would have "definitely batted" if he had won the toss, so both teams have got what they want. Now Zimbabwe need to put up a better show to keep the series alive heading into the final match While Shashank is off to a well-deserved lunch, this is Saurabh Somani to take you through the initial bit of this game. Raiyan Ferdous : "Just a correction: We are all in Chattogram. The English name of Chittagong has been changed to Chattogram recently." The playing XIs for you Bangladesh: 1 Liton Das, 2 Imrul Kayes, 3 Fazle Mahmud, 4 Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), 5 Mohammad Mithun, 6 Mahmudullah, 7 Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 8 Mohammad Saifuddin, 9 Mashrafe Mortaza (capt), 10 Nazmul Islam, 11 Mustafizur Rahman Zimbabwe: 1 Hamilton Masakadza (capt), 2 Cephas Zhuwao, 3 Brendan Taylor (wk), 4 Sean Williams, 5 Peter Moor, 6 Elton Chigumbura, 7 Sikandar Raza, 8 Donald Tiripano, 9 Brandon Mavuta, 10 Kyle Jarvis, 11 Tendai Chatara Isam with a golden nugget: "This is the first time in 16 years that a Chittagong player doesn't feature in an ODI in Chittagong." 2.00pm Masakadza calls incorrectly, unchanged Bangladesh opt to bowl. Zimbabwe make one change: Chigumbura in, Ervine out 1.50pm Mohammad Isam is digging into a hearty meal. Good luck to him in his bid to stay awake. The toss is just 10 minutes away. Meanwhile on India's east coast, in Vizag, Virat Kohli has won the toss and elected to bat. Can he get to 10,000 ODI runs today? Shuvo Shafiqur : "Big day for Liton and Kayes again. They have to try to provide a good opening start at a very good batting track in CTG. If Bangladesh bowls first i am going to observe how Saif bowls in the death overs. Bangladesh needs to also find ways to pick up wickets in the middle overs especially on flat tracks." A dejected Tafadzwah Marey says: "The torment that comes with supporting Zim Cricket is unbearable. In the previous match most of our specialist batsmen got "bowled out" which is worrying. We are still struggling to play spin in this day and age. I do not know what to expect anymore. I am just waiting to see what they have in store for us." Zmn: "There shouldn't be and I suppose, will not be any change in Bangladesh squad. Well if team management thinks different, Shanto can be pushed in to replace Liton. If done, that will be purely for giving the youngster an opportunity to gather experience." Zimbabwe have trialled seven different opening combinations in ODIs this year. Bangladesh's top order hasn't set grounds ablaze either. Barring the final of the Asia Cup, the last time a Bangladesh opening pair lasted the first ten overs of an ODI innings was back in January. Can they set that right? Liam Brickhill assesses in his match preview. 1.30pm Warm welcome, all. We're in Chittagong for the second ODI. Bangladesh wriggled out of trouble courtesy a sublime Imrul Kayes century two nights ago. Zimbabwe's bowlers dominated early, then lost the plot to leave their floundering batting with a task too steep. Can they turn it around? Coach Lalchand Rajput sounds optimistic.
items.text: straight ball on the stumps, a touch fuller. Defended with a straight bat
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Masakadza, no run

items.text: strays down the pads a touch with the angle, allowing the batsman to tuck it to mid-on. They hesitate a bit, but run through for the single

items.preText: round the wicket to the left-hander
items.text: strays down the legside, but gets away with it. Not called wide by the umpire. Perhaps it just brushed the pad

items.text: beaten keeps it full and in the channel, drawing the drive. Plays and misses
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Zhuwao, no run

items.text: flicked away with the angle to deep square leg. Mortaza was bowling from wide of the stumps and went too full, allowing him to work it away
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Zhuwao, 1 run

items.text: beautiful shot waits for it and strokes this through the covers for a boundary. Fuller outside off, and in driving range - Masakadza doesn't miss out
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Masakadza, FOUR runs

items.preText:
Here's the Fizz

Chayon : "A good day for the asian cricket lover. Three giants of Asia (IND, PAK, BAN) are in the field today. Two eyes are not enough to see all the matches. What to do Saurabh?" - have three Cricinfo tabs open of course!
items.text: on a length, keeps it well outside off. He lets it go through to the keeper
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Zhuwao, no run

items.text: swing and a miss length outside off, moving a touch. He went for an almighty heave, but connected with air only
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Zhuwao, no run

items.text: some shape away from the batsman that time. He watches it carefully and lets it go through
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Zhuwao, no run

items.preText: eddie: "Rare to see a 35 year old fast bowler still playing for his country. Makes it extraordinary when you realise his age is also equal to the number of operations he has had on his legs." - Mortaza is an inspiration no doubt
items.text: straight past the bowler, but off the toe-end. Didn't time it well.
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Zhuwao, 1 run

items.text: angled across the right-hander, he gets a thick inside edge that rolls to short midwicket
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Masakadza, no run

items.text: full on off, plays it with an angled bat down to third man for a single
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Masakadza, 1 run

items.preText: Anas varkala: "Interested to see the performance of Raza after a little break." - Yes, I'm sure how Sikandar Raza goes will be one of the subplots to watch out for in this match
items.text: strays on the pads, allowing Hamilton to whip it away towards deep square leg, where the man was quite fine and had to run to his left to mop up
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Masakadza, 2 runs

items.text: lovely shot Mortaza's not getting his line right. On the pads again, and he flicks it with beautiful timing through midwicket for a boundary
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Masakadza, FOUR runs

items.text: gets it straighter that time, and he defends it from the stumps towards mid-off
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Masakadza, no run

items.text: he's strayed down leg again, but this time Masakadza doesn't quite get the timing and placement right. Taps it to mid-on
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Masakadza, no run

items.text: full outside off, he comes on the front foot to defend solidly
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Masakadza, no run

items.text: length ball on the stumps, he closed the face of the bat to punch this through midwicket.
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Masakadza, 2 runs

items.preText: Zmn: "There should've been a provision that each national squad MUST have at least ONE "over 50" playing member. I would then try to grab a position for myself."
items.text: full ball, he runs it down to third man from the stumps, opening the face of the bat

items.preText: Dipu: "I think Zimbabwe will fight back..They have nothing to lose here..Hope to seee good fight."
items.text: fuller on the stumps, and he goes for the drive, but doesn't time it well enough. Straight to short cover

items.text: swing and a miss he's pushing it across the right-hander, and it's moving away. Tries to drive it without the feet moving too much, doesn't connect. That was close to the outside edge

items.preText:
Saifuddin comes in. Short opening spell for Mortaza then

Engineer Tanbir: "More correction Raiyan Ferdous! It should be CHO not CHA and the correction is Chottogram."
items.text: short ball on leg stump, but doesn't rise much. He tried to tuck it away but missed
